page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The parishes of{Lydiard Millicent}and {Lydiard Tregoze}are situated west of Swindon and partly within the borough of Thamesdown . The{western expansion of Swindon}has brought about substantial social changes. The population has increased, new housing estates or{"urban villages" have been built, the economy has changed from agricultural to industrial and many people commute via the{M4 motorway}. A tributary of the{River Ray}rises in the western sector and flows north- eastwards acting as boundary between the parishes. There is a ridge of brash soil overlying{Corallian {limestone}in the north, but the predominantly clay soil supports {dairy farming.} {D.J.Payne
